contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Fukutomi'''|福富町|Fukutomi-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Kamo District, Hiroshima|Kamo District]], [[Hiroshima Prefecture|Hiroshima]], [[Japan]]. On February 7, 2005 Fukutomi, along with the towns of [[Kōchi, Hiroshima|Kōchi]], [[Kurose, Hiroshima|Kurose]] and [[Toyosaka, Hiroshima|Toyosaka]], all from [[Kamo District, Hiroshima|Kamo District]], and the town of [[Akitsu, Hiroshima|Akitsu]], all from [[Toyota District, Hiroshima|Toyota District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Higashihiroshima, Hiroshima|Higashihiroshima]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipality of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 2,879 and a [[population density|density]] of 47.42 persons per km². The total area was 60.71 km². It was nearly destroyed when the [[atomic bomb]] was dropped on Hiroshima during [[World War II]]. ==External links== * [http://www.city.higashihiroshima.hiroshima.jp/ Official website of Higashihiroshima] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Hiroshima Prefecture]] {{Hiroshima-geo-stub}}
